result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:33 PM Defendant John Marvin Norris in court.  Attorney David V. Meany appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Rachel E. Pisors appeared by video for John Marvin Norris.  Information filed, attorney waive formal reading, pleas NG, noted.  Atty not requesting a speedy trial.  If case is not resolved at STC will set for trial.
Status conference scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

8:14 AM Defendant John Marvin Norris appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Rachel E. Pisors appeared by video for John Marvin Norris.  Attorney David V. Meany appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. State calling Sgt Correctional Officer - Dustin Halvorson, sworn -- testimony given. State moving for admission of Exhibit 1 and Exhibit 2. Exhibit 1 and Exhibit 2 are admitted. State asking the record reflect the witness identified Defendant. The record will so reflect. Attorney redirect. State has no redirect. State's argument -- asking to be bound over. Attorney's argument. Court finds PC Def has committed a feloney -- case is bound over for ARGN. Motion to modify bail in file -- follows upon a previous motion which the court heard on 6/17/22 -- State opposes motion. Court grants motion to modify to a signature bond. Def doesn't need to sit in custody any longer on this case. Cash bail converting to a $5,000.00 signature bond. Def can appear via Zoom for next hearing. Def will need to sign a new bond. Bond to be sent to Jefferson Co to be signed.
Arraignment scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Arraignment on September 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
for Modification of Bond

3:01 PM Defendant John Marvin Norris appeared by video, in custody from Jefferson County.  Attorney Ruth Kressel appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Rachel E. Pisors appeared by video for John Marvin Norris.  Last court date the Atty had not had a chance to go over the report with def.  Atty had conversations with def about report, claims to be competent.  State competent.  Def claims to be competent.  Court finds def competent.  No waiver of time limits for prelim hearing.  A timely prelim hearing had been scheduled, and than competency was raised by Atty.   Atty spoke with def prior to hearing today, asking for a STC, court absent a waiver for time limits is scheduling a prelim hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 08:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 19, 2022 at 08:00 am.

Attorney def is unwilling to communicate with attorney, asking for adjournment.

8:46 AM Defendant John Marvin Norris appeared by video, in custody Jefferson Co jail.  Attorney David V. Meany appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Rachel E. Pisors appeared by video for John Marvin Norris.  COVID - ZOOM; all parties agree to appear via ZOOM today.  Atty comments- reason to doubt competency for the client. The Ct can not go forward with the prelim once competency has been raised. Ct rev'd the compl and finds PC the def committed a crime in Ashland County based upon the compl. 
Ct orders the def be examined to see if he is competent to proceed.

Preliminary hearing on June 24, 2022 at 08:45 am.

03:00 PM Defendant John Marvin Norris in court with attorney Rachel E. Pisors.  Defendant John Marvin Norris in custody in Onidea Co Jail.  David V. Meany appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  John Marvin Norris appeared by video means with Attorney. Atty comments-- will waive prelim and waiver has been filed.  Back on record (3:06pm) Def and atty talked in a break out room. Atty would need an adjment of waiver, def would like to talk things out. State comments on adjment. 
Ct comments- Def has a right to a timely prelim, Ct schd a timely prelim. Def was going to waive right today, State called off witnesses. Ct finds that those actions of the def are a waiver of time limits.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 08:45 am.
